description: Concatenate the first n odd numbers in reverse order.
comments: a(n) starts with the digits of 2n-1. Indices of prime or probable prime terms are 1,2,37,62,409,...: see also A089922. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 13 2008
references: Mihaly Bencze [Beneze] and L. Tutescu, Some Notions and Questions in Number Theory, Sequence 3.
links: Florentin Smarandache, Sequences of Numbers Involved in Unsolved Problems, arXiv:math/0604019.
maple: P:=proc(i) local a,n; a:=1; print(a); for n from 2 by 1 to i do a:=(2*n-1)*10^floor(evalf(1+log10(a),100))+a ; print(a); od; end: P(100); - _Paolo P. Lava_, Jun 19 2008
prog: (PARI) t=""; for( n=1,10^3, /*ispseudoprime*/( t=eval( Str( 2*n-1,t))) & print(n" "t)) \- _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 13 2008
author: M. I. Petrescu (mipetrescu(AT)yahoo.com)
extensions: Edited and extended by _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 13 2008
